subject: Psychology
title: Milgram's Obedience Study
description: A quick win: understand Milgram's Obedience Study.

hook.text: A man in a lab coat says 'please continue.' So you press the button and deliver what you believe is a lethal shock.

buildup.text: Stanley Milgram wanted to understand how ordinary people could commit atrocities during the Holocaust.

discovery.text: 65% of participants obeyed to the maximum 450-volt shock when an authority figure insisted they continue.

twist.text: Participants weren't sadists. They sweated, trembled, and protested â€” but obeyed. Authority overrode conscience.

climax.text: Milgram showed ordinary people can do terrible things under authority. Evil isn't about character â€” it's about context.

punchline.text: Obedience to authority can override personal morality.
